definitions.definition: To breastfeed : to feed (a baby) at the breast ; to suckle .
To breastfeed : to be fed at the breast .
To care for (someone), especially in sickness ; to tend to.
examples: She nursed him back to health.

definitions.definition: To tend gently and with extra care.
examples: She nursed the rosebush and that season it bloomed.

definitions.definition: To manage or oversee (something) with care and economy .
To drink (a beverage) slowly, so as to make it last.
examples: Rob was nursing a small beer.

definitions.definition: To cultivate or persistently entertain (an attitude, usually negative ) in one's mind; to brood or obsess over.
To hold closely to one's chest .
examples: Would you like to nurse the puppy?

definitions.definition: To strike (billiard balls) gently , so as to keep them in good position during a series of shots .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To breastfeed : to feed (a baby) at the breast ; to suckle .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To breastfeed : to be fed at the breast .
( transitive ) To care for (someone), especially in sickness ; to tend to.
( transitive ) To tend gently and with extra care.
( transitive ) To manage or oversee (something) with care and economy .
( transitive , informal ) To drink (a beverage) slowly, so as to make it last.
( transitive , figuratively ) To cultivate or persistently entertain (an attitude, usually negative ) in one's mind; to brood or obsess over.
( transitive ) To hold closely to one's chest .
( transitive , billiards ) To strike (billiard balls) gently , so as to keep them in good position during a series of shots .
